message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV 

The paper discusses a machine learning approach to action planning, which falls under the category of reinforcement learning and control. Specifically, the paper focuses on using learned and differentiable forward models to perform planning in both discrete and continuous action spaces. This suggests that the paper is likely to be relevant to several sub-categories within computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), robotics (cs.RO), systems and control (cs.SY), and computer vision (cs.CV). Among these, machine learning and artificial intelligence are the most likely categories, as the paper primarily discusses the use of learned models to perform planning. Robotics and systems and control are also relevant, as the paper discusses the ability to perform efficient gradient-based optimization in continuous action spaces, which is important for many robotics applications. Finally, computer vision is also a possible category, as the paper discusses the use of input noise when training the forward model, which is a common technique in computer vision.
